This is from The Queen (magazine, not monarch!) November 2nd 1918: â€˜Dancing for the winter season is already beginning in town, and with splendid news causing everyone to be more cheerful, prospects look decidedly gay for the young men returning from the Front.â€™ #WW1 #Centenary

I thought throughout this week I would share some comments from women's fashionable magazines from November 1918 - I will never not be fascinated by the topics they discussed through the war, and how they investigated 'the subtle alliance between fashion and circumstances'.

I can't believe the week of the armistice centenary has come, I've been thinking about it for a long time. And having started my research on First World War fashion in the summer of 2014, it also feels very appropriate that my viva takes place in the month of November 2018.
